creditline: Gift from the Helen D. Ling Collection in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Art
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: five children in a procession; boy wearing blue tunic at right leading a white goat (?), with a boy in red riding on the goat's back; two children follow goat--one carrying a red staff with gold and green elements at top; boy wearing pale green tunic and grey pants in LLC, carrying a pink peony plant in a dark grey vessel; three trees with thin trunks at right behind walkway where children are processing; inscription in black at left, with two small square red seals
title: Children in a make-believe procession
